abstract: Profitable American companies enjoyed a 12.6 percent tax rate, far below the federal statutory rate, thanks to legal loopholes, according to the Government Accountability Office.
snippet: Profitable American companies enjoyed a 12.6 percent tax rate, far below the federal statutory rate, thanks to legal loopholes, according to the Government Accountability Office.
lead_paragraph: The biggest, most profitable American companies paid only a fraction of the taxes they would owe under the official corporate rate, according to a study released on Monday by the Government Accountability Office.

headline.main: Big Companies Paid a Fraction of Corporate Tax Rate
headline.print_headline: Big Companies Paid a Fraction of Corporate Tax Rate
